p: Other papers published in the literature already reported the presence, and fate of enveloped viruses [ 18] or the inactivation of an Enveloped Surrogate Virus in Human Sewage [ 19]. The results of this last paper were performed as a way to model Ebola presence in sewage. The inactivation kinetics of enveloped viruses in sewage used certain bacteriophage, as RNA member of the Cystoviridae, as a potential surrogate for enveloped human viruses in sewage. Results reported that it can undergo 6–7 log inactivation in sewage in 3–7 days, depending on temperature.
